title: The Latest: South Dakota teen faces charges in girl's...
text:
A prosecutor in South Dakota on Wednesday charged a 17-year-old boy as an adult in the slaying of a missing 16-year-old girl from Wyoming after her body was discovered in the suspect's basement.

Michael Gavin Campbell made his initial appearance at the Meade County Courthouse in Sturgis this morning and was charged with second-degree murder for the death of Shayna Ritthaler.

Meade County Sheriff Ron Merwin said he couldn't yet share details on how the girl died, but Ritthaler's mother, MinDee Ritthaler, revealed in a Facebook post that her daughter had been shot.

Michael Campbell, 17, was charged as an adult on Wednesday in the shooting death of 16-year-old Shayna Ritthaler (pictured)

Investigators say the body of the teenage girl from Moorcroft, Wyoming, was found in a basement room at Campbell's home in Blucksberg, South Dakota, 90 miles away, on Monday.

Ritthaler was reported missing by her family on October 3, according to the Meade County Sheriff's Office. It's unknown whether the victim was kidnapped.

Merwin said told the Rapid City Journal he doesn't know if the suspect and victim knew each other.

The body was found when deputies and agents from the South Dakota Division of Criminal Investigation executed a search warrant on the request of the Lawrence County Sheriff's Office, which was working with investigators in Wyoming, the sheriff's office said in a Facebook post.

Acting Meade County state’s attorney Michele Bordewyk said Campbell lived at the home in Blucksberg with his mother and that he had recently moved there from Brookings.

Bordewyk asked Judge Kevin Krull to order Campbell held without bond, saying that the 'defendant was with the victim and an argument led to him shooting her,' reported the station KELO.

Ritthaler (left and right) was reported missing in Moorcroft, South Dakota, on October 3. Her body was found on Monday in Campbell's basement in Blucksberg, Wyoming

The judge set Campbell's bond at $1million. He is due back in court for his arraignment next Thursday.

If the 17-year-old is convicted of the second-degree murder charge at trial, he could face a life in prison.
description: Michael Campbell, from Wyoming, was charged as an adult on Wednesday in the shooting death of 16-year-old Shayna Ritthaler, who was reported missing in Moorcroft, South Dakota, on October 3.
